column2: -71.0674594329559 A Charlestown Woman http://antiq.wiki/?s21-l424 In 1647 or 1648
column3: "A Charlestown Woman" was executed for witchcraft despite maintaining her innocence
column4: only confessing to a past theft for which she believed she had been forgiven by Christ. Her execution was part of a series of events where individuals were accused and punished for witchcraft across Massachusetts
